result.execSummary:
The defendant William L Groce was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and IS Eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Probation may be transferred to Dodge County.

miscConds.notes: Fine to be paid as a condition of probation.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered. Sign releases for agent.
90 DAYS, CONSECUTIVE TO HUBER SENTENCE. NO Good Time allowed on DRC. If defendant successfully completes the Day Report Center, the 90 days of Stayed Huber will be permanently stayed.

Inform Agent of all prescriptions. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Maintain employment and/or school combination. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Non-working hours (Huber). Release for standard conditions. Commencing 07/07/17 by 5pm. May be served in Dodge County, but NO Electronic Monitoring allowed. LAST 90 days are Stayed for Day Report Center.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant William L Groce in court with Attorney Samuel W. Benedict.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin and Law Intern Jim Fitzgerald.  Case called for sentencing.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Benedict makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

3  1/2 YEARS IMPRISONMENT 
  -  18 MONTHS YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -   2 YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

TERM OF PROBATION:  3 YEARS   * May be transferred to Dodge County*

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases.
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

FINE:  $829.25 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME:  270 Days- last 90 DAYS STAYED for Day Report Center, Non-working hours with standard release conditions to commence 7/7/17 by 5:00 p.m.  *May be served in Dodge County - No electronic monitoring allowed* 

DAY REPORT CENTER:  90 DAYS, Consecutive to Huber sentence.  Good time not allowed on DRC.  If defendant successfully completes Day Report Center, the 90 days of Huber stayed will be permanently stayed.  

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Character letter dated June 17, 2017.

Sentencing hearing on June 29, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney Benedict requests a sentencing date after 6/9/17.  Court sets sentencing date.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 29, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
